head.title: The Unanswered Questions About T.W.A. Flight 800

hedline.hl1: The Unanswered Questions About T.W.A. Flight 800

abstract.p: Richard S Reade letter holds Christine Negroni, in July 16 essay, perpetuates myth that fuel-tank explosion caused downing of TWA Flight 800 (S)

block.p: To perpetuate the myth that a self-ignited fuel-tank explosion brought down Flight 800, Christine Negroni, a non-aviator and non-engineer, had to ignore more than 200 witnesses to the missile track as she asked all of us to ''stop worrying about Navy ships and radar tapes,'' tapes that were hidden from public view for years while the government altered evidence to cover up the real cause of the tragedy.

To perpetuate the myth that a self-ignited fuel-tank explosion brought down Flight 800, Christine Negroni, a non-aviator and non-engineer, had to ignore more than 200 witnesses to the missile track as she asked all of us to ''stop worrying about Navy ships and radar tapes,'' tapes that were hidden from public view for years while the government altered evidence to cover up the real cause of the tragedy.

A civil suit has been filed by James Sanders, an investigative reporter who acquired evidence that a missile passed through the aircraft, research for which he was harassed by the same National Transportation Safety Board that suppressed the eye-witness accounts and radar tapes.
The truth will out. Character counts.
